com.comphenix.xp.extra

Class ConstantRandom

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Random
      • com.comphenix.xp.extra.ConstantRandom
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ConstantRandom
extends java.util.Random
    Represents a random number provider that uses a byte array a source of random numbers.
    Author:
    Kristian
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static ConstantRandom MAXIMUM
      A random number generator that always returns the largest possible value.
      static ConstantRandom MINIMUM
      A random number generator that always returns the lowest possible value.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConstantRandom(byte wrapValue)
      Constructs a random generator that uses an infinite stream of bytes as the source of "randomness".
      ConstantRandom(byte[] data)
      Constructs a random generator from a given byte source, starting at the given bit offset.
      ConstantRandom(byte[] data, boolean wrapAround)
      Constructs a random generator from a given byte source, starting at the given bit offset.
      ConstantRandom(byte[] data, boolean wrapAround, int offset)
      Constructs a random generator from a given byte source, starting at the given bit offset.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Retrieves the bit array we're using as a source for our random numbers.

      Whether or not we wrap around after reaching the end of the byte array.

      Sets the bit index in the byte array we're reading from.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConstantRandom

        public ConstantRandom(byte[] data)
        Constructs a random generator from a given byte source, starting at the given bit offset.
        Parameters:
        data - - source of bytes to use in the random number generator.

      • ConstantRandom

        public ConstantRandom(byte wrapValue)
        Constructs a random generator that uses an infinite stream of bytes as the source of "randomness".
        Parameters:
        wrapValue - - the value that will be copied infinitely in the stream.

      • ConstantRandom

        public ConstantRandom(byte[] data,
              boolean wrapAround)
        Constructs a random generator from a given byte source, starting at the given bit offset.
        Parameters:
        data - - source of bytes to use in the random number generator.
        wrapAround - - TRUE to wrap around when the reader has reached the last byte element, FALSE to raise an exception.

      • ConstantRandom

        public ConstantRandom(byte[] data,
              boolean wrapAround,
              int offset)
        Constructs a random generator from a given byte source, starting at the given bit offset.
        Parameters:
        data - - source of bytes to use in the random number generator.
        wrapAround - - TRUE to wrap around when the reader has reached the last byte element, FALSE to raise an exception.
        offset - - the bit to start reading from.
